body.__cdata:
Takes an image and stores it in "test.fits".
This will override the previous test image.
Single Frame\, 1 Exposure.

Promotes the test image "test.fits" to the next numbered image.
This only works if the test image was the last command/action.

Single Frame\, 1 or Multiple Exposures.
Save in Numbered Image File.
NOTE: Stop Series Button will stop multiple exposure series
      as soon as the current one is finished.

Resets all the fields to default values
Default Values are read from the config file.

tooltip.body: Initialize the Filter Wheel Axis.
Move Filter Wheel Now.
Resynchronize Filter Wheel to position 1.
Sends the initialize commands for all axes on this card.
Sends the Home command for all axes on this card.
Kills All the Active Commands.
The content of this text box will be in FITS OBJNAME && OBJECT keys.
Selecting this check box causes the Image Title to be populated automatically by the science target name.

body.__cdata:
"Readout Complete" sound will play after a readout 
has been completed. It does not depend on whether 
it was the end of a series or not.

"Exposure Complete" sound will play at the end of each 
exposure (start of the readout) within a series where
num_exposures > 1 except for the last one. The last
last exposure in the series is pre-empted with the
"Series Complete" sound so if that sound is off\, nothing
will play.

"Series Complete" sound will play at the end of the last
exposure for the series and it overrides "Exposure Complete"
sound so for num_exposures = 1 only "Series Complete" sound
will play.

"Blocked Exposure" sound will play if LOIS detects a problem
with the exposure\, such as bad telemetry\, and blocks the
exposure. Please check LOIS logs for more information for
the reason the exposure was blocked.

1     P   Moving in positive direction
1     M   Moving in negative direction

2     D   Done (ID\, II or IN command has been executed\, set to N by this command or IC command)
2     N   No ID executed yet
  
3     L   Axis in overtravel. Char 4 tells which direction. Set to N when limit switch is not active.
3     N   Not in overtravel in this direction

4     H   Home switch active. Set to N when home switch is not active.
4     N   Home switch not active

Sends pointing offset command to the DCT TCS. The following options are available for types:
- tplane (tangent plane) - default
- simple (coordinate based)
- pa (position angle based)

All offsets supported directly by the TCS are absolute not relative. An offset of
0\, 0 always returns to the original pointing origin specified with the Science Target\,
or the last pointing that was 'absorbed'.

The units are:
- tplane: arc-seconds for both offsets
- simple: offset1 in seconds of time & offset2 in arc-seconds
- pa: offset1 in arc-seconds & offset2 in degrees

tooltip.body: Sends pointing offset command to the DCT TCS.
Sets the absolute offset to 0.0\, 0.0.
Current position becomes the pointing origin.

body.__cdata:
Simulates sending of a relative pointing offset command to the DCT TCS. The type options
and units are similar to the absolute offset.

TCS only supports and understands absolute offsets. We are simulating a relative offset
by sending an absoulte offset and then issuing an absorb command immediately afterwards 
to move the TCS's pointing reference.

Neither the TCS or the LMI LOUI are keeping track of the origin so to go back to the original
science target\, the user needs to either issue the slew command again or trace back the offset
path back to the origin. Absolute and relative offsets should not be intermingled.

tooltip.body: Sends absolute offset and absorb commands sequentially to simulate a reletive offset.

body.__cdata:
Performs a dither function based on a pattern file.
Format of the input lines:
"Title" exposureTime offset1 offset2 filterName "Comment"

Offsets supported directly by the TCS are absolute not relative. An offset of
0\, 0 always returns to the original pointing origin specified with the Science 
Target\, or the last pointing that was 'absorbed'.

Performs a slew\, dither\, or a filter move based on a pattern file.
Please refer to the documentation on Confluence for the format of 
the input lines.

Offsets supported directly by the TCS are absolute not relative. An offset of
0\, 0 always returns to the original pointing origin specified with the Science 
Target\, or the last pointing that was 'absorbed'.

Loads the pattern file and validates the input.
The default extension is *.txt but the dialog box
allows selection of other types.

Executes the commands in the current row of the pattern file.
The commands can include a move (slew or dither)\, filter move\, and
and exposure command.

Aborts the execution of the pattern as soon as possible. If an exposure
has started\, LOIS may decide to continue the exposure depending on where
it is in its execution loop. The file will not be saved.

Pauses the execution of the pattern at the next actionable item. An
exposure or a series of exposures will continue till concluded.

tooltip.body: Resumes the execution of the pattern.

body.__cdata:
If guiding\, make sure that this value (maximum dither 
radius) is not larger than the dither tolerance for the 
guide star.

The guider code does not check for this value and if this
condition is violated\, the probe will reach a limit and 
the guide star will not be re-acquired properly.

The focus base is the midpoint of the focus sweep. The first acquisition 
is done there and then the focus sweep starts from low to high. If the 
focus fails or is aborted it will return to this value\, irrespective of 
what the focus base was before the script ran.

Send current values to JOE\, accumulate on JOE\,
and send the results to AOS by publishing to broker.

tooltip.body: Clear (set to 0) the accumulated values on JOE.
Clears JOE's accumulator and sends zeros to AOS.
Get the accumulated values on JOE and update the display.
Reset the values in the text boxes to 0.
Takes the first image to be used as guide reference.
Sends the Guide On command to the TCS and starts the occultation series.
Sends the Guide Off command to the TCS and aborts the occultation series.

body.__cdata:
A push button for issuing the command.
It does not reflect the state of guiding.

A push button for issuing the command.
It does not reflect the state of guiding.

Disables the Guide On/Off buttons.

A push button for issuing the command.
It does not reflect the state of guiding.

Re-enables the Guide On/Off buttons.

Send a "DN0" command to the PDU which will return
the status of all the sockets in this PDU.

The timestamp will update automatically when the
message is received from the PDU.

Send "Fxx" command to the PDU for all the lamps.
This will turn all the lamps off.

tooltip.body: Enables the buttons for controlling the lamps.

body.__cdata:
Disables the buttons so one does not accidentally
turn on a lamp in the middle of an observation.

tooltip.body: Selecting this check box adds {cds=true} to the LOIS exposure command.
